intro: Duvalia andreaeana, commonly known as the Andean duvalia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its aesthetic appeal.
